Reviews.Title: “Alexandra in Crisis”
Reviews.Author: Yevgeniy_Nitefly
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel about 3 times before, so I chose it for my vacation this spring. But I was disappointed and I doubt if I ever stay there again. At the beginning my on-line reservation was lost, luckily I had printed copy. The hotel personal kindly arrange a place in the other one not far a way. But the quality is less (IMHO). The second reservation was ok. But the room is missing: bathrobe, slippers, a bottle of free water, TV mostly in Spanish. The breakfast is unbelievable expansive (18 EURO + 8% TAX) for one. Around the conner in the restaurant you can pay for the same for 2 persons 13 Euro. Sometime there was a bad smell from the bath drain system. I expected a little more for the average of 200 EURO a day. At least "thank you" for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: annuk14
Reviews.Content: We hold a three-days business meeting for 20 people in late March 2012. The location is excellent. Rooms, meeting rooms and meeting services were good. Also staff was very kind and very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alexandra hotel during my business trip last March. Not only the stay was wonderful and unbeatable location in Barcelona, but also, since most important Gaudi buildings are just around the hotel, I had the opportunity to do multiple tourist visits on my free time and after my business meetings. The room was new and very comfortable, staff very professional and serious. The entire hotel has a super nice boutique type of style which I loved. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but hotel could be much better!”
Reviews.Author: throppy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as it was the cheapest hotel we could find in the city centre at incredibly short notice (the day before!). Upon arrival, our room wasn't ready, which was a little inconvenient, although the hotel did offer to hold our luggage so we could roam the streets until our room was ready. The general appearance in the lobby is one of a modern, and sleek hotel, bu the cracks really do show when you get to your room. Ours was on the third floor, overlooking the main entrance street. The carpet had numerous unsightly and questionable stains and was like office carpet - with no underlay making it not relaxing to go barefoot on. The glass screen in the bathroom was broken, exposing a very sharp edge, and worse of all, the air con blew out a steady stream of warm air, which you couldn't turn off! The corridor outside out room has no ventilation whatsoever, making it a very muggy and uncomfortable wait for the elevator. The staff were friendly and courteous, and the hotel is located fantastically just off the Passieg de Gracia, about 7 mins walk from Placa Catalunya and the top of La Rambla. There are most certainly better places to stay, but if you aren't too fussy, it'll probably do!

Reviews.Title: “great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: jean marc n
Reviews.Content: the hotel has a perfect location with walking distances to mosts of the attractions of the city(I suggest walking down paseo de gracia till the port). rooms are a done with a very delicate taste combining modern furnitures within a classic building where large glasses offer a warm wellcome. Very nice and smiling staff and great fresh breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Grand design poor service”
Reviews.Author: babymummy1
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a long weekend in the lively. Ity of Barcelona My husband was invited on business and the Alexandra was the hotel we were designated for our stay First impressions were initially good The location is excellent situated in the vicinity of the smart passage de Garcia A short walk to the smart shopping area and level walk to the popular sagrada cathedral The hotel has spent time and money on the design and set of the entrance It is just a shame it is not maintained Bulbs out on the lighting display in the lounge and the walls are quite scuffed Our room was on the top floor and to be honest very ordinary for a 'design' hotel I would give it a three star rating certainly not boutique The bathroom was grubby There were tiles missing which were visible when u were in the bath as were rusty brackets under the Sink, not very luxury as the hotel bills itself I told the reception staff three days running that the light in the mirror was nt working, but no one came to fix it We ordered room service on the second night for our son The tray was taken away in the morning but left at the other end f the corridor ! It was still there two days later when we checked out! We know it was the same tray as I left the napkin in an unusual spot So clearly there is some housekeeping issues I would save your money and stay elsewhere there are so many great hotels in Barcelona Unfortunatly this is not one of them

Reviews.Title: “Nice Design Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paolo M
Reviews.Content: Alexandra Barcellona Hotel is a nice design hotel. The fornitures are simple but confortable and serviceable. Clear colour, parquet, TV and frigobar. The position has a very good position closed to Casa Pedreira on one of the most faschionable street of Barcellona. The breakfast is very expensive but there are a lot of "pasticerie" closed to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location.”
Reviews.Author: Emily A
Reviews.Content: Is a hotel that we really liked the design and decoration. The bar that is downstairs is so cool, and at the noon there is a great sun. The hotel is next to the best shops in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent room”
Reviews.Author: Alicia J
Reviews.Content: We loved the room very much, very spacious and exquisitely decorated. You're in the real center of Barcelona, with views of Las Ramblas The receptionists very friendly. In the restaurant we ate very nice food. Hotel highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great days!”
Reviews.Author: Laura N
Reviews.Content: Has a fantastic location in the city center. We slept in an urban room, wich was really beautiful!! the employees are really nice and we had everything we need. Breakfast buffet was complete! we had a perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time here and once again very pleased”
Reviews.Author: mahopac
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel again, i was taking a cruise and needed one night in Barcelona. I was again just as satisfied with the location/service/value of this property. Just can't say enough about the location You are in the best neighborhood to be in and you can walk everywhere you need to be. Service, rooms, everything is great and the price is excellent for Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “just good”
Reviews.Author: 84doctor84
Reviews.Content: It was a good hotel comparing to what you get in Europe. The biggest advantage was that it is quite close to ramblan which is central point for tourists.The food and beverages are quite affordable in terms of quality and prices.The bar in ground floor gives you a very good view of the street outside which is a luxury in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: goingtravellingcork
Reviews.Content: I travelled here with my boyfriend last year. The location was great really, away from all the hype and buzz of les Ramblas, but close enough that we could pretty much walk anywhere we wanted. We got on of the bus tours- the name escapes me, which was fantastic. We got on it a few minute walk away from the hotel. We went to Guelle Park on the tour which was brilliant and also went to the Nou Camp Stadium- amazing!!!We did have to queue for a while though so be prepared for that, and make sure to bring lots of water on the bus AND DRINK IT!.... I made the msitake of not drinking enough water and suffered majorly the next day after going out for a few drinks that night- not a good idea. We also got the train to waht we though was Stiges, but we actually got on the wrong train- the inspector was not impressed, but we didn't know. We ended up going to a different beach near Garraf which was lovely. On the food front, we went to the Hard Rock Cafe, good food and good service. We also found some smaller places on the other days which were also very nice. We went to see the European Athletics Chamionships which were great. We also took a lift across the city and up towards the stadium where the athletics were held- I wouldn't advice it if you're scared of heights. I'm not afraid but felt very shaky on this!! Very hot temperatures there when we were there, but definately a place I would go back to!Brilliant. The rooms in the hotels were great- air conditioning, black out blinds. The view wasn't great but we were barely there! The reception staff were always very helpful and we were able to leave ourr bags the final day as we weren't leaving until later that day. I would definately reccommend this hotel to anyone looking for somewhere as a base to explore the city!Very safe to walk to at night also :) Hope this is helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Very positive experience”
Reviews.Author: ieily
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and was part of a group of 8 people, extremely kind and accomodating reception staff allocated rooms close to each other giving us the peace of mind of not having loud people around. Bedrooms were on 4th floor and mine was facing main road and yes, it is noisy and loud facing that side so if you can ask to be moved away from it; I had earplugs with me so it was ok. The rooms are big and spacious and beds are very comfortable, I just think they should upgrade the pillows! The one thing I did not like was the bathtub which had a very small glass screen and having a shower meant water was going all over the bathroom floor but loved the fact bathrooms have a bidet! Breakfast is really good, a lot of selection of fresh sweet pastries/bread and savoury; the little Nespresso coffee machine makes an amazing coffee/cappuccino and it's there for guests to use during breakfast time (7-11am). We also had lunch at the Hotel restaurant "Da Luca" and the food, real authentic italian, was absolutely amazing, I had the Ossobuco and it was to die for. Location of Alexandra Hotel really is perfect and safe, 2 minutes walking and you find yourself on Passeig de Gracia which is a really nice road full of great shops and fantastic to stroll on day or evening time. I would go back in a hearbeat

Reviews.Title: “details make the diference”
Reviews.Author: irapap
Reviews.Content: hotel alexandra is in a great location and very well decorated....we have booked a superior room and at the reception very kindly informed us that they would give us an even better room...i am from a very popular touristic place of the world and i realy know the the diference between a standard and and sup room...i didnt find any in our reservation..its was as standard room a little more bigger....the other thing that we didnt like at all is that our room smell very ,very ,bad as a toilette...we told at the reception for the smell but nothing changed...and of cource a small detail that someone else before me wrote ..is that for sure the walls are thin as a paper.....it good be a very nice hotel..but yes there are some details that make the diference...yes i would suggested it for the location and the nice decor and beds..but please do something with the important details.....

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience here”
Reviews.Author: europhileAustralia
Reviews.Content: Arrived late in the afternoon after a fraught journey returning a hire car to Perpignan Europecar and motoring in with friends from France.Manager waiting for us and told us we were staying at another hotel as they had booked in a conference load of guests.Naturally we were gobsmacked as we had booked the rooms 3 months before.We were taxied to the AC hotel Diplomatic 2 blocks away and told we were getting a free breakfast at the Alexandra the next morning after we taxied back.This was not ideal as we had no safe to get our valuables in and had to carry them with us for the first day.Returned to find luggage in our room and all OK.Clean and modern room on first floor was on street side and a little noisy from the crazy Barcelona traffic.Some doors on adjoining bathrooms groaned like howling dogs and the plumbing were noisy too.Staff apologetic about situation and our breakfasts were free for the rest of the stay.(€19.50 is outrageously expensive for breakfast here!) of 2 more nights.Very expensive though position good and staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: Seashore987654321
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel Alexandra for my hen party, there were 11 of us in total. On reaching the hotel we were pleasantly suprised, the lobby is smart and welcoming and the staff very helpful and friendly. We also noted the great location the hotel was in, surrounded by lots of cafes and in the shopping district, it was perfect for us. I and 4 of my other friends were given rooms on the 8th floor , at first I thought - Great, until we had to take the separate lift - more like a service lift - only big enough for 2 people with luggage and very very slow! On reaching the 8th floor, the corridor was very hot (certainly not air conditioned) we made our way to our room and were dissapointed. The room was very tired and shabby, a total contrast to downstairs, it was also very small and cramped - even after I had asked in advance for a larger superior room as it was for 3 people. Nothing appeared to work, not even the brand new TV - perhaps that was why it was so new!! I even called down for someone to fix this but no-one ever arrived. The shower was rusting and had little power and some of the bath towels had seen better days. On another note 2 of my friends had a room on the 4th floor with balcony and said it was very modern and comfortable and they were very happy indeed. Overall for our needs, the hotel was perfect and had a great little street cafe that was a nice place for all of us to meet - a bottle of Cava for 12 euros and for the morning great coffee and pastries. I would definitely stay here again but next time opt for a superior/modern room on a lower floor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but rude staff”
Reviews.Author: PlanetSeeker80
Reviews.Content: Good: location close to the Rambla. Fitness room. Bad: The staff arr terrible at english. Very unfriendly and the reason why I wont reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect home base in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: snowshy
Reviews.Content: The 6 of us spent 4 nights/ 5 days in Barcelona at the Hotel Alexandra prior to a 12 night Mediterranean cruise. I had read other reviews and was hopeful that we'd picked the right hotel. Everything was definitely "right" about this hotel.! The rooms were clean, modern, spacious (by European standards) and air conditioned. The staff was helpful, friendly and most spoke reasonable English; especially the front desk staff which helped with directions and tips about what to see & do. (Also, there is a helpful weekly event guide which the hotel prints up in several languages.) The location is within walking distance of many excellent eateries, public transportation, 3 of Gaudi's unique buildings, the famous La Rambla and some great shopping in the Eixample area. The hotel also offered an optional Continental breakfast which was a little pricey but with a good variety and generous refills of coffee. Most mornings we ate at one of the small cafes nearby but on the mornings when we needed to be out early for a tour, we really enjoyed the convenience of the Alexandra's continental breakfast . The lovely accomodations and excellent service of this small hotel are better than I've experienced at some "boutique" hotels in other cities AND at a far more reasonable price. My experience at the Hotel Alexandra helped make Barcelona my favourite city in Europe. I'm definitely going back to the hotel and the city.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Rajroyal
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. Nice, clean and friendly staff. Close to all the happening places.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: A17ACR
Reviews.Content: Stopped for 3 nights in early July and was wowed in every avenue. Great location lovely staff found all of them helpfull from reception, porter, breakfast staff. Paid for a superior room but got uprgaded to a suite room 516 was an amazing room.Massive bed and so comfy 2 tvs double jacuzzi bath and great shower twin designer sinks. Also seperate lounge area and safe deposit box. Lovely bar also at reasonable prices and lounge area with lounge seating. Stopped at W hotels and this compares alongside these.Only improvement could be tea and coffee in rooms and also breakfast could be quicker restocked as a couple of mornings had to wait for items to be replemmished. Would recommend this hotel to everyone great location approx 6 minutes walk from top of Ramblas

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DublinNina
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed staying here as it was near to everything,it is a high class hotel the only problem was that there was no tea making facilities in the room, however they do a great breakfeast

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel -- Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Shaina86
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean. Great area right off Passeig de Gracia where lots of shopping can be done. I really enjoyed staying here. The only complaint I have is that the room smelled like cigarette smoke. Otherwise it was a good experience with a friendly, helpful staff. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Inexperienced front desk”
Reviews.Author: tonytuna
Reviews.Content: In terms of pros, the hotel has an excellent location, around the corner from Casa Mila. It also includes an extensive breakfast buffet. With regards to cons, the front desk staff were a fount of misinformation, such as how to obtain tickets to the Palau, the closing time of Corte Ingles, and where to post mail. The front desk staff seemed disinterested, as they were often on their cell phones. I would not recommend, as their are much better four star hotels in town.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but you have to pick the right room”
Reviews.Author: Vickio
Reviews.Content: Most of Barcelona's hotels were full when it came to booking so we opted to spend seven nights at the Alexandra. We found a special pre-paid rate on the hotel's website: a deluxe room with complimentary breakfast. It wasn't an especially cheap deal. On arrival we asked the woman at the front desk for a quiet room at the back of the hotel. Without comment she sent us upstairs to a very small, bare room with a tiny bathroom that was more no-tell motel than international four-star. According to my booking confirmation we were entitled to a large, welcoming, well decorated room, with king-size bed. Not even close. I immediately called the front desk and within minutes a very apologetic young man came up and showed us three very nice options. What a difference!! In the end we accepted a lovely, sixth floor room at the front with a king bed, nice decor and large, beautiful bathroom. We were never disturbed by traffic noise while we were there: the hotel is at the top of the Ramblas in an up-market shopping district and is especially quiet during the week. I think the first woman I spoke with on check-in should have handled the situation more professionally. It is very unpleasant to arrive exhausted and start your vacation by complaining about the room. However, it was the only glitch.. I agree with previous reviewers who were thrilled with the breakfast. It was most unusual for a European hotel to offer such a range of hot and cold options. And the service was first class. In all, a good base for exploring Barcelona and there were plenty of bars and restaurants around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They spent all their money in the common area!”
Reviews.Author: funkybuda
Reviews.Content: Barcelona was our last stop among our 4 stops travel in Spain last week, and this hotel by far is the worst one that we have stayed in. Everyone else is right on its convenient location, but that itself should not qualify it to be a 4 star hotel. Pros: Good location to Casa Mila, high end shopping area, 5 mins walking to closest metro/subway stop. Great looking lobby and good front desk staff Cons: Everything else! The room has a feel of cheapness to it that words can not describe. It seems that only minimum effort has been put in to just keep the room just livable. The carpet is stained and old, you can see the walls are cheaply plastered and painted in a rush, the furniture probably wasn't changed since the 80s. And the fact the room cleaning staff probably spend the minimum effort does not help the cause either. Our used glasses/mugs are left totally untouched and not replaced, the hot water jar we got from room service are still left behind. All in all, this is one of those hotels that probably spent most of their budget in putting up a great lobby to be photographed, and did nothing remotely to improve the room qualities. We can hear everything that's happening in the room next door and the one above. It remained to be one of the last unbooked 4 star hotels in the region for a reason. And if you do end up booking it, please set your expectation low, or else you'll definitely be disappointed as soon as you open the door to your room, just like we did.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: foodieintl
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean, and modern hotel. Unbeatable location, close to shops, restaurants and metro stations. Staff very friendly, albeit not knowledgeable, but we were able to take advantage of the free wifi and used our handheld to find all the information we needed. Small grocery store right across the street, pharmacy around the corner, between two main streets in the nicest area of town. Cons- no connecting rooms available so hard to travel with small children

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but we weren't made to feel comfortable here”
Reviews.Author: emosbo
Reviews.Content: when we arrived at the hotel, their was confusion about our reservation, the lady behind reception dealt with this in a very rude manner, she was tutting and sighing and managed to make us feel like it was our fault their was a problem. she was very rude, lacking professionalism and avoided us quite obviously whenever we approached the desk after this occasion. however, the rest of the staff were very helpful, its a shame their efforts will be tarred by this one lady's bad attitude. the rooms are very modern and clean, however there was no handbook informing you of what was available at the hotel, even simple things such as breakfast times, check out times or about the local area. in addition, the we could not work the wifi, even with help of the staff, so this was very disappointing. unfortunately, we were woken by a constant drilling noise at 8am sharp both mornings of our stay. of course, these things do happen, but we do feel that something could have been done about this because the noise would have disturbs many rooms, not just ours. these are only minor problems, but ones that did considerably effect our stay and influenced our opinion of the hotel. its in a good location, but a metro to the beach is required, however its near to all the cultural sites.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, chic hotel - would love to go back!”
Reviews.Author: mhughes76
Reviews.Content: My partner suprised me with a weekend away for my birthday to Barcelona in November 2009. On arrival at the hotel I was amazed, quick chic in and helpful staff. We were also given a 'voucher' for a complimentary glass of bubbly! A fantastic location, near to good transport links and walking distance to points of interest. A very chic, well designed hotel. The room was slightly smaller than my partner thought he had booked but it was still exceptionally cleaned and designed. The hotel is situated by a number of places of interest including Casa Batillo, stylish restaurants and bars. Passing traffic did make it a little bit difficult to sleep to begin with but it didnt last long. We did not eat at the restaurant but did have a drink in the downstairs bar before venturing out to the city. I had both a wonderful time and I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a fabulous place to stay and a romantic break - my partner actually proposed during our stay there! Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location/Fantastic Staff/Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mahopac
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed with the wonderful service of the staff at the Alexandra hotel. We arrived early and checked our luggage. When we came back the luggage had been placed in our room. They all spoke excellent English and were eager the help . The room was a standard room and was well appointed. It had a nice modern decor, the bed was very comfortable, flat screen tv, the bathroom was also modern. The location cannot be beat. It is around the corner from Casa Pedrera and Paseo de la Gracia the most fashionable street in Barcelona. It is near the metro stop Diagonal.. You can get everywhere from there.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: Lynney58
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, centrally located, up-to-date rooms with comfortable beds. The hotel staff very helpful. Enjoyed every minute spent there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: tinyh98
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended hotel. Plush, cool lobby which sets the tone. Great front desk staff, who were helpful with directions and so on. Rooms are enormous for a city centre hotel. And the location is superb - around the corner from La Pedrera and La Rambla, and near two metro stops.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel Right off the Rambla”
Reviews.Author: mstraveler38
Reviews.Content: The hotel was decorated in a modern taste and was very cool. The location was great! It was right off the main Rambla. It was also very close to two of Gaudi's houses, La Pedrera and Casa Batillo. There was no need to buy breakfast from the hotel because there was a great breakfast shop callled el Fornet 2 minutes away. It was a very comfortable and interesting stay.

Reviews.Title: “Guter Durchschnitt, aber keine vier Sterne wert”
Reviews.Author: M_Gingrich_1957
Reviews.Content: Zentral gelgenes Hotel, exzellentes Frühstücksbuffet, nette kleine Bar für Abends. Die Zimmer sind allerdings recht klein und in den heißen Sommermonaten ist die Klimaanlage (falls sie überhaupt funktioniert, wir mussten deswegen einmal das Zimmer wechseln) heillos überfordert. Bestenfalls als Drei-Sterne-Hotel zu werten, man fragt sich wirklich, woher dieser vierte Stern kommt...

Reviews.Title: “A great base for getting around barcelona”
Reviews.Author: manxman25
Reviews.Content: Nice location in the business district about 80yds from "La Pedora" and only a 10 minute walk to the old city - quite - nice restaurants and bars round the corner on a pedestrianized street. Convenient for the underground. Very contemporary style - nice clean and modern - our room was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but no amenities for long-term business travel”
Reviews.Author: Aristoseimi
Reviews.Content: I called the Hotel Alexandra home for three weeks in March of 2010. The vast majority of the staff were friendly and attentive, and the decor is very modern minimalist (but still warm, somehow). The good: the room service salad was excellent, and the breakfast buffet was also very good (although after three weeks of the same choices, it got a little boring). The maids were also extremely friendly and thorough (although she kept taking my iron away every day, so I finally had to start hiding it under the bed). The bad: the wifi is unacceptable, especially in a hotel with so many business travelers. There's no gym, and the "queen-sized" beds are two twins shoved together -- unfortunately, they slid apart fairly easily, so I would often find myself falling into the crack between the two beds in the middle of the night. All in all, I think the Hotel Alexandra is passable for a short-term stay, but because of the lack of gym and internet connectivity, I wouldn't recommend it for longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “Hated Every Minute of Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: PurpleQueen
Reviews.Content: I have never written a travel review, but my unhappiness and disappointment has prompted me to write one now. My husband picked this hotel after seeing some pictures and reading some reviews. The ONLY thing this hotel has going for it is the excellent location, but if you can afford to shop in the very expensive stores surrounding the hotel, you don't need to stay here! This hotel has a 4 star rating, but it must be self rated, believe me, it was not a 4 star hotel. The front desk staff had an attitude and were not particularly helpful, the bath towels were small, thin and rough...well you get the idea. For the price, they should have included a continental breakfast, at the very least. lt was a beautiful day in Barcelona, a little warm (in the upper 60's) when we checked in. Beware if you are considering this hotel during the warmer months: the hotel does not have air conditioning and the room was hot and stuffy. Our room was on the 4th floor. We opened the very large window (door to the french balcony) to get some air circulating and oh, my gosh, the 24 hour noise from the street was so loud! Air vs noise...what to do? We chose to get the air circulating, but it really wasn't enough to cool down the room. We stayed 1 night after our cruise. Luckily, we had an early morning flight because I could not wait to check out!

Reviews.Title: “Overall 8/10 Experience”
Reviews.Author: avidfan02
Reviews.Content: In bullet form, here are my comments about the hotel: - Great location in Eixample, just north of the heart of Barcelona. The "Diagonal" metro stop was a short walk away. Good shopping and restaurants nearby. - Friendly, helpful staff resided in sleek lobby with bar - Convenient restaurant serving buffet breakfast but BEWARE....they charged 25 Euros per person. Too expensive!!! - Free WiFi was great....get instructions at the check-in desk - If you request a streetside room you get a small balcony, but BEWARE you also have to contend with street noise. We were awakened by a noisy crowd at 5am after the bars let out. - For some reason there is no A/C in the hallways. This created a sauna feeling when you stepped off the elevator (4th floor) en route to your room. Good thing it only lasted 30 seconds each time. Overall a good experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: MortimerOnTheMove
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated in the Eixample area of the city. The lobby and the bar to the left of it are fairly chic. We were there as a group; some of the rooms were very nicely appointed; others, done in a different style, less so. We soon realised that there were two types of room: those with a small window which looked on to a brick wall about 60cm away, and those on the street side which had the noise of the traffic going by. In its quest to be trendy the hotel also has, as we later discovered, a nightclub in the basement which pumps out booming disco music till very late. This was audible from rooms on the second floor so anyone not intending to dance themselves to sleep in their bed might wish to ask for a room on a higher floor. The staff were very friendly and helpful; the ones we dealt with spoke fluent French and English in addition to the obligatory Castilian and Catalan.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, but noisy & unfriendly oh and don't bring the car!”
Reviews.Author: Redrebeltraveller
Reviews.Content: First the good bit.... The hotel itself is stylishly presented and in a perfect location right in the heart of the shopping district - literally a stones throw away from the beautiful Passeig de Gracia, a short walk to Las Ramblas, La Segrada Familia and the several Gaudi buildings in the surrounding area. The bad bits..... On arrival at the hotel beware of the lift situation. Previous reviews (which I was grateful for) had warned about the lift if you are staying on the 6th, 7th or 8th floors, and they were right! As we were staying on the 7th we had to take this particular lift and as a result had the most claustraphobic, frightening trip I have ever encountered to reach our floor. The lift was so small you could only fit one person plus luggage into it and it took an age to reach its destination. TIP: If you are staying on the 6th, 7th or 8th floors, take one of the nice big glass lifts (why do they only go to level 5?!?) to the 5th floor and then walk the two or three flights to the upper floors. Trust me its safer! Our experience of the Hotel Alexandra was also unfortunately overshadowed by noise. We complained after our first night that we had been disturbed by noise from two other rooms on our level (kids running up and down the corridor screaming and slamming doors at 1am, 2am etc) The staff apologised and said it wouldn't happen again. Unfortunately it did, the next night from the same rooms. At 3am when we had all had about as much as we could take I contacted reception who apologised but did nothing to resolve the situation and just said "Well they are leaving soon anyway". We were also checking out early (6am) and did so after having a second night of very little sleep. We informed the staff on checkout again of the noise issue and they just shrugged in their usual unfriendly way. They really didn't care. Next came the battle with the car park. If you are considering driving to Barcelona and leaving your car at the Hotel Alexandra - DON'T. Not because its not safe, but because its highly unlikely you will be able to get it back out again without needing a new clutch! The car park is extremely small (almost impossible to manoeuvre an estate car in) and has the most ridiculously narrow steep spiral exit / entrance ramp from both upper and lower levels which is also slippery so difficult for tyres to grip. You are only given approximately 2 minutes to exit this 'assault course' before the electronic security shutter at the top closes again and you are left suspended at an narrow angle on an extremely steep hill that even the most sturdy handbrakes would struggle with. (Someone then has to get out of the car without scraping their door off the wall and climb to the top of the ramp to re-open the shutter). Put it this way, If you think the lift sounds frightening, don't try the car park! It's such a shame that this hotel was a disappointment. It had the potential to be so good. It is extremely unusual for me to complain about a hotel or write a bad review but our experience there was so unforgettable that I feel it is only fair to warn other people. If you are looking for a hotel that's right in the heart of Barcelona, reasonably priced and you're not too bothered about noisy neighbours or unfriendly staff then maybe take a chance and stay here (just don't bring the car). Equally, if it's decent quality service and a good night's sleep that you're after, perhaps it is best stay elsewhere. Whatever you decide to do, make sure you visit Barcelona. It's amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: Its_Scandinavian
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Barcelona and I love to stay in the Eixample. Alexandra have the best location between Rambla de Catalunya and Passeio de Gracia. Easily take the airport bus to Placa de Catalunya and walk 10 minutes and you will have the hotel directly on front – next to several restaurants, Gaudi’s houses, museums, Burberry and upper brand shops, but also Benneton, Zara and Massimo Dutti. The Alexandra itself is an ok hotel, not elegant or totally modern – it’s just a good business/leisure hotel with good standard. Rooms are small and contemporary, nothing special. No bathrobes or slippers – I also missed a shower gel. Cleaning was very good and the hotel is fresh. Breakfast was excellent and very nice with a lot of fruit, cakes, bread, cheeses, hot dishes, mozzarella, ham and jucies. Every morning we needed to ask for extra new coffee, it was cold and old. However – the nice breakfast staff was giving us a hot good coffee accordingly. Front Desk staff was terribly, no service and absolutely no knowledge about the city. You need to be your own concierge! Don’t miss the café and bakery next door at Rambla de Catalunya, and you need to take a cocktail or dinner at Omm. I would stay here again if I got a great deal but my favourite in Barcelona is still Granados 86 Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “dreadful experience at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GEMSNewJersey
Reviews.Content: last week i was robbed INSIDE this hotel. the employees of the hotel were less than helpful - they did not call the police (which the police later told me they were supposed to do), they did not offer a phone to call and cancel credit cards, they basically told me to leave the hotel and go to the police station. the police said this was highly unusual and even suggested that someone from the hotel may have been involved. later, when i asked for the name of the head of the hotel so i could lodge a complaint, they refused to give me his name. they refused to compensate me in any way for a theft that happened ON THE PREMESIS, they refused to provide any assistance, they refused to comp me on any part of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: ellewoods30
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so noisy! It's quite near to everything so that was good but we got no sleep at all! We could hear the kitchen and also everything in both rooms next to us and the room above us. It didn't help that the cleaning staff were so noisy at 6am next door! I wouldnt stay again, purely because of how noisy it was all night!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and modern and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: sydcam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a short holiday for 4 days. Was excellent location for metro and trains to airport. Also walking distance to two Gaudi houses. Did not have any food at hotel, but lots of restaurants, tapas bars just metres away. Room was very comfortable and modern. There were no tea/coffee making facilities, but that is standard for most Spanish hotels. Service was overall good, but only problem which occured was on last day. We had been told when checked in that could have late checkout by an hour and half. We were told this was confirmed and had been put into hotel computer system, and so we planned our schedule accordingly. However on day of checkout, different person at desk said she had never been informed of this,and therefore we had to vacate rooms within half hour. This was said in quite rude manner, and no apology was made, or any attempt to verify with another staff member if any other arrangements had been made. In the end this did not have huge impact on our plans, but slightly marred our otherwise enjoyable experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ptitlu
Reviews.Content: Very good location, nice room and breakfast. Very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and Poshy”
Reviews.Author: Antonio-ASJR
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights with my wife. Couldn´t sleep at all. Rooms have terrible acoustic, you can hear everything is going on the next rooms. First we had a room on the second floor. There was a kitchen somewhere near, and the noise was so laud, until 2 am, that we asked to change rooms. When we did, the attendant at the front desk was so rude that it seemed like we where bothering him to ask for such a thing... After getting a new room, they said that we could go out and that they would take our luggage in to the new room, but since we had our passports and money for a trip that would last for another 20 days, we asked them to keep those valuables on the hotel´s safe. Done deal, we went out. When we arrived, no one could find our passports. It took 1 hour and lots of phone calls. At the new room, we had the same problem, but this time with a party group next room... If you want to rest after a day visiting beautiful Barcelona, avoid this hotel and its terrible service.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Kajon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Alexandra and we would certainly stay here again. We had a Jr. Suite and it was exactly like the website photos. The room itself was average hotel room size with king size bed. The bathroom was fabulous. It had a great shower and a whirlpool tub. But our favorite was the oversized terrace. There was plenty of room for a table and chair set along with 2 full size lounge chairs. We enjoyed our morning coffee and evening wine on the terrace. The hotel wanted to upgrade us to a full suite, but we opted to stay with the Jr. suite because of the terrace. The location is very safe and very convenient. Coffee, Coca cola, water, snacks, and wine are just out the door. We walked home from dinner every night and never felt threatened. It was convenient to two of the Gaudi houses and to the hop on/hop off bus. A street full of fine dining options is just a block to the left (Passig de Gracia) and the upper Ramblas was just to the right and loaded with cafes and tapas bars. Teri Hanson

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RBMD
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here. Well situated near major sites, Metro stations,restaurants, shops, etc. Room small, but perfectly adequate. Hotel frequented by business folk. Excellent buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the short walk away from Plaza Catalunya!”
Reviews.Author: gracefulflirt
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on location, price and viewing of pictures before settling on Alexandra for my second trip to Barcelona. The first visit I stayed at an apartment hotel. Rooms are modern, clean, comfortable, had lots of English TV channels, and good lighting, but don't expect any extras for this 4 star hotel. Inner rooms are quieter and away from traffic. Sometimes you could hear neighbours opening the curtains, but not conversations. The queen size bed and pillows were plush! The lobby area is comfortable, well-decorated, has a nice bar/table area and even has a laptop for guests' use. Staff are generally fine, but do not go the extra mile to be helpful. The friendliest staff are the bartender, bellboy, and housekeepers while front desk staff are merely proficient and willing to accommodate when they can. Seems like they work long hours, but no excuse not to smile or say hello. You can't beat the location off of Rambla Catalunya and between Passeig de Gracia, two main streets with good varied shopping, bakeries, bars and cafes. There is a little, well-stocked quality bodega/store across the street from the hotel to buy water, yogurt, snacks and even bomba rice (for paella) to bring home! Overall, I enjoyed my stay at Alexandra. It lived up to my expectations. But I would have been happier if the staff were more friendly, although they came through on changing my room when I requested a double bed and not twin beds pushed together.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel very clean great location friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RMoore_9
Reviews.Content: Kristophe on reception very helpful room was very comfotable, although you would expect tea and coffee making facilities.Located in a nice area of Barca only 15 mins walk to La Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but don't stay in room 102!”
Reviews.Author: Chookybirdy
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Alexandra it looked great. Clean, contemporary styling and the staff were very helpful and had good English. We had paid extra to upgrade our room to a 'deluxe' and were saddened to find that when we opened the curtains that 2 feet outside was a huge plant room which completely filled our view, upwards and across. We had absolutely no view of anything other than a louvered wall, so couldn't even see what the weather was like! On the surface the room looked good. Large enough with a modern toilet and shower, however there were a number of things that spolied our stay, which on their own would not have presented a problem. Firstly the 2 drawers in the room were tiny. They were around 8cm or so deep, which meant we struggled to get even underwear into them. The toilet roll holder was broken, there were parts of the shower broken, one of the power points didn't work, but most annoyingly the air conditioning didn't work. This meant we had to open the window to cool the room down, exposing us to the noise from the kitchens below, which was horrendous. This may seem pretty negative, but the staff were great at reception and the bar, where drinks were reasonably priced. The hotel is in a great location for attractions, the bus tour route and lots of restaurants and shops. We may have just been unlucky with our room, but perhaps an upgrade is not worthwhile at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LanarkshireTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year. It was a very nice hotel in a good location. 10min walk to the centre. Very nice rooms however did not particularly enjoy Barcelona that much. If you do decide to go then you should consider staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and city”
Reviews.Author: DishGagan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Alexandra for 3 nights and found it to be an excellent hotel. The taxi fare from the airport was 30euros and took 20mins but the fare does vary with the time of day and what day you go. The hotel was clean and reception staff were great and spoke good english. I stayed in a standard room which was very quiet and clean. The room does have the amazing TV with loads of channels but to be honest half of them don't work and the English ones consist of BBC east midlands, BBC london, BBC west midlands etc The room was nice in size and the bathroom was good as well, only 2 little gripes, no Tea/coffe making facililties and no ironing boards or trouser presses in the hotel. If you want anything ironed you have to pay for it, would expect a 4star hotel to at least offer you an ironing board! The breakfast was available from 7-11 and offered a good selection of food. Location wise the hotel was 10 minutes walk to la ramblas which was a bit much in the mid day heat. If your using the Turistic tour bus then the gracia la pedrera is round the corner from the hotel and is far less crowded then the main bus stop at placa de catulunya which had huge long waits for buses. Overall this is a great hotel which i would def return for...

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel for families with young children”
Reviews.Author: BRuhle
Reviews.Content: Our overall experience was very positive, I must say, even though it is not the most friendly hotel for families with young children. The hotel location is priviledged - next to Paseo de Gracia, Las Ramblas, the port. The breakfast is superb - very varied and delicious (although the tortillas de patata were frozen!). The rooms are clean and comfortable and the shower is good. The negative points are the parking - very badly designed, difficult to manouver. The room service doesn't work 24 hours - actually it is very inefficient. Some staff are very unfriendly - mainly the ladies at the bar/restaurant and breakfast. On the other hand Javier, Esther and Gabriel are very helpful and sweet. The staff is not well prepared to give recommendations e.g. for places to eat. I was looking for a vegetarian or organic restaurant to get something healthy for my 16-month-old daughter to eat (it is very difficult to find non-fried food in Spain or boiled vegetables, for example) and was recommended a chain called "Fresc Co" but Javier really tried hard to find more restaurants but the thing is that it seems they are not familiarized with the concept of healthy food, which people working in the tourism industry should be. As a personal tip, f you're really hungry at 3am in Barcelona, I recommend you try Bagoa at Plaza Doctor Letamendi (not far from the hotel) and their jamon canario, delicious! La Bodegeta, suggested by the hotel, closes at 1:30am. Finally, my impression from the hotel was that it was renovated recently but it was only a "facade" renovation - you can see the furniture in the rooms is old, for example.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheekyhen
Reviews.Content: 14 of us stayed here for a hen weekend & our stay was almost faultless. The only "problem" we had was one room had a very loud buzzing during the night (room 505) apparently it was to do with it being above the restaurant) however as soon as we mentioned it to reception, we were immediately moved without fuss to a suite! so we were more than happy, the hotel staff even moved all of our luggage. Check -in was fine, as there was 14 of us it took a while but no longer than you'd expect, plus we were all upgraded from standard to deluxe rooms. Breakfast was quite pricey at 18euros each, but it was a buffet & you could eat as much as you like, so if you have a big appetite, perhaps its good value, and if you didn't want to pay 18euros then don't eat it!... The location was excellent, 5min cab journey to Las Ramblas, which was approx 6-7 euros. Approx 8/10mins cab ride to the Bogatell beach , this was roughly 9-10euros, worth it as we tried the metro & that was a nightmare experience because of the heat!.. I would definately stay here again, the staff were very friendly, one of the nights we all gathered in reception on our way out & we were quite noisy taking photos (as we were on hen wkend) and the staff were more than happy to help take photos & join in... I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Barcelona, great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Alexandra Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkLongford
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to stay in. We stayed in the Alexander hotel during the last week of July 08. The hotel is located near La Pedrera. It is on Mallorca Street which is off Passeig de Gracia. This is a nice area, safe with plenty of shops and restaurants around. There is a small corner shop across the road for groceries which we found very useful (breakfast is quite expensive). The Metro (Diagonal) is a couple of blocks away, just over 5 minutes walk. The top of La Rambla is 20 minutes walk. If you’re arriving from Barcelona Sants train station (train from El Prat airport stops here) get the Metro or taxi to the hotel. Although the start of Mallorca street looks relatively close to the train station on a map, the hotel (no. 251) is near the other end – don’t try walking it like we did!! Initial impressions of the hotel were excellent. The hotel has a very modern look and the foyer /reception area is nicely decorated. Laptop in the foyer has free internet access if you get a time when it’s available. The corridor to the rooms are also modern and clean. The room was spacious but I was disappointed on first impressions with the appearance. We were on the third floor, room 304. This is a standard room. The furniture looks dated and worn. It has a cheery wood colour as opposed to the dark wood in the rest of the hotel and the photos on their website. There were a lot of areas where the colour of the wood is worn and scratched away (see photos). The carpets were stained throughout and again looked dated and tired. I had a look at the other rooms on the same floor and they looked the same so we didn’t see any point in complaining and trying to get another room. Over time this mattered less as the room was spacious, clean, well serviced and comfortable otherwise. There were no tea/ coffee making facilities which I was disappointed about. The room was air conditioned. The conditioning had 3 settings but the lowest setting wasn’t working. So we had it set at the middle setting which was very noisy, especially at night. TV has a good selection of channels including 3 or 4 english channels (BBC 1 & 2). Bathroom was a good size and has a bath and good shower. Staff were friendly for any interaction we had. We tried eating in the restaurant one night but after a 20-30 minute wait were told that they weren’t serving any more. Didn’t appreciate that too much as we had to rush out before the restaurants in the area closed and we were starving. Even though I may seem critical of the hotel, overall we enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would recommend it. We would stay there again also.

Reviews.Title: “Nice contemporary Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BF-UK
Reviews.Content: Good location in Barcelona. The hotel has a contemporary feel and the service is excellent. I liked the rooms - modern, yet comfortable. TV wasn't the easiest to use, but had the best array of English channels I've ever come across! Breakfast was fine. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: xnickersx
Reviews.Content: I thought i would write a review as i found it hard to find reviews before i traveled here. Just got back from a weekend at the Alexandra hotel Barcelona with my boyfriend. The hotel was amazing! Really posh and everything was neat and tidy and up-to-date. There is a bar in the hotel reception, this is really nice and extremely modern. Staff are really friendly and will help if you have any issues, like booking a taxi for the return journey. The taxi cost about 25euros each way. The lift is amazing with a TV inside, there is a restaurant but we did not use this as we stayed room only and found it quite expensive, there are many really nice restaurants near by. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from Las Ramblas, the main shopping area, and i would recommend walking rather than getting the train as there are many pick pockets (a woman attempted to steal out of my boyfriends bag and less than a minute later out of my bag) I would defiantly make sure you have bags that are hard to get into and carry them on your front. The room was clean and the bed was made everyday, the bathroom was nice and there is a safe within the room. Hope this helps, if you have any questions feel free to email

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sicra
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Alexandra was a very pleasant and a courteous one. After a 15 minute wait to check in (but what the heck have a drink you're on holiday) because of departures we were thanked for our patience and upgraded to a large top floor room overlooking the main street with a jacuzzi. The room was clean, very spacious with an extremely comfortable bed however the bathroom was beginning to look tired. The Alexandra is listed as a 4* and was no more than we expected from a central city hotel. We felt secure in the area of the hotel when out walking very late and were always welcomed or reassuringly challenged when entering the lobby late at night. 2 main lifts to the 5th floor then 3 flights of stairs to the floors above or a very scary ride in a small service lift, the only down side but our choice for the high room. Reception staff and bell boys sincere and welcoming and the evening barman a pleasure to sit with. We were concerned with stories of pickpockets and muggings but we had no problems or witness any. As with any city just be sensible and leave the diamonds and gold at home, no handbag and don't flash your money. From the hotel it's a 10 minute walk to the metro and main bus stops then a further 5 minute walk to the top of La Rambla past designer shops, a mixture of cafes, restaurants and Tapas bars. Excellant stay in a good location, would return.

Reviews.Title: “Highly overrated”
Reviews.Author: sguntupalli
Reviews.Content: I was overall disappointed with my stay at this hotel. The staff is arrogant and rude and was not very helpful. At one point I bought an internet card which did not work and returned to the front desk for another one and the clerk said that I was causing "too many problmes" in Spanish to her co-worker. Since I am fluent in spanish I told her not to bother and left. The rooms are TINY and I mean tiny by european standards. There is ALOT Of construction so the lobby is really not existent. The positives are the hotel is clean and modern and in a great area but I will not be staying with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel (despite the building work)”
Reviews.Author: Meandmycat
Reviews.Content: No problems at all with this hotel - good size and clean rooms. Good range of English TV including local staions and our room had a jacquzzi/bath. Breakfast excellent and despite the fact were not warned about extensive building works during summer 2007 we were not really troubled by the work. Just along the road - left out of the reception, literally a few metres away there are two good, friendly (and comparatively cheap) bars. The Ramblas de Gracia is only 50 metres away - turn right out of the reception (good place for open air eating , tapas etc) bus stop is outside and Metro and mainline rail is 4 blocks (10mins) away. Overall well satisfied

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cailine
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Alexandra. We booked through Easyjet and can honestly state that we were hugely disappointed at the star rating attributed to this hotel. In our humble opinion this hotel is in no way a 4* establishment. We booked a junior suite and were 'upgraded' to a suite. The suite was on the 7th floor accessed by the most claustrophobic lift that I have ever experienced. The suite overlooked back yards littered with rubbish. The suite itself was shabby and even with every light in the room on was dark and oppressive. We complained and were moved to another suite. This one was at the front of the building and a slight improvement on the first but for the fowl smell which we eventually identified as coming from the toilet. In the morning we woke to a plume of dust hanging heavily in the air over our bed. This we presume came from the renovations being carried out on the lobby area (something which we weren't told about by Easyjet) and which added to the desolate appearance of the place. We complained again and were moved to the junior suite with balcony which is what we had booked with Easyjet. This was an improvement and by way of apology a complimentary bowl of fruit was sent to our room. The staff is courteous enough but this place has nothing by way of luxury. The towels were well worn and grey and the one time we ate in the restaurant we were the only people eating there. To add to the tale of woe, my daughter actually spotted green mold on a breakfast roll, fortunately before eating any of it.

Reviews.Title: “Junior suites highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: MF2007Manchester
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - 5 minutes to la Pedrera and Casa Battlo (and metro), 10 minutes to Placa Catalunya. Highly recommend the junior suites - great outdoor, rooftop space, table plus chairs and 2 sunloungers with automatic sun blind - great first thing and evenings. Book at least 2 months in advance to get best rate and, depending on time of year, breakfast included in rate. Huge spa bath also a nice feature. Very friendly staff, maybe the "Dragon" referred to elsewere has moved on?! Fourth time in Barcelona and this is best hotel I've tried. Buidling work at time of stay which may add to reception area - didn't disrupt stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is ok, but beware of construction in the lobby.”
Reviews.Author: nataukr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel Alexandra for 4 nights Aug 5 - Aug 9. The hotel is pretty decent, nothing special really. When we were there there was a cosntruction going on in the lobby. Not that it bothered us too much, the workers would separate the working zone from the rest of the lobby with some kind of drapes, but still you could hear the hammer and drill and etc. You would think why couldn't they choose the lower season for this, and not the one when there are thousands of tourists in town. The room was ok, always very clean, plenty of toiletries. The hotel is about 15 minutes walk from Plaza Catalunya, but you can quite entertain yourself visiting designer shops on your way to the center, so with all the shopping it's not gonna seem that long. And of course it's close to different attractions, and Bus Touristic stops. There is no bathtub in the bathroom, just the shower. We had breakfast at the hotel, it was quite good, the same every morning, but plenty of variety (in my opinion): several kinds of cold meat, cheese, cerial, bacon, srambled eggs, fruits, juice, pastries. Price of breakfast was included in the room rate, but usually it costs 17 euros, quite expensive, considering tons of restaurants in the area where you can have breakfast for twice as cheap, an starbucks around the corner. We used room service once on arrival, the food was brougt to our room really quickly, in about 10 minutes, but tasted pretty average. Hope my review will help someine who's choosing a hotel to stay, like all the reviews posted here helped me when i was looking for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location above all”
Reviews.Author: GlamorEyes
Reviews.Content: Me and My wife visited in Barcelona to celebrate our anniversary. The Hotel is placed perfectly for us since we like to tour by foot. The great location saved us the tiering routine of catching the Metro to go to the first site of the day. Also returning to the hotel is quite easy since the Metro station (Diagonal) is a block away. Near the hotel you will find many Tapas Bars and great shopping. We skipped breakfast in the hotel and drink our openner coffee in one of the many coffee shops around. There is a Bus from the airport to catalunia square and it is 7 minutes of walk to the hotel. The room is quite large, very functional but with low athmosphere. All the equipment is new and nice. To summerize - Location above all .

Reviews.Title: “Designer hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: HendrikM
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice in this swanky hotel and truly enjoyed it. It has a great location and the building is very impressive. It’s recent refurbishment included installing very techy and fancy gadgets such as Bang & olufsen phones, multi-gang showers and massive plasma TVs. It is very comfortable and the service is very good. That said, in both occasions I was in Barcelona for business and thus my company picked the bill – for which I was grateful as the hotel felt slightly overpriced. I guess they needed to recover their investment! One of the best thing about this hotel: it is very conveniently located to reach probably some of the best tapas in Barcelona (Cerveceria Catalana nearby!)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonJetstar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alexandra for 3 nts, on a short break to celebrate my mothers birthday. As it was a special occasion I booked a "superior" room, however it was very basic to be called superior in a 4 star hotel! I must say it was very clean and comfortable though. However it was quite noisy and what we thought would be the air-conditioning was some other sort of machine causing the noise at night. Even though reception changed our rooms when I told them about the noise, there was no apology and I got the impression they had that complaint from people who stayed in that same room previously. Breakfast was a bit of a disappointment...nothing special when you are paying 17 Euro for it. Now, location was great! You can walk to the Ramblas, both to Diagonal and Passeig de Gracia and all the lovely shops and there are many tapas bars and restaurants to choose from within 5-7min walk. Would I stay there again? NO!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreatDaneDanmark
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 days at the Alexandra in February. The taxi ride from the airport took about 25 minutes, and check in was efficient and swift. I had booked a superior room, and found it to be very confortable and had no problems at all with noise from traffic. The hotel is very well situated for both sightseing or shopping, and very close to excelent restaurants and tapas bars. Gaudi*s La Pedrera ( Casa MIla) is only 2 blocks away, the Ramblas even closer and you can easy walk to the Sagrada Familia ( about 1,4Km). Breakfast is expensive , you get a much better deal by having breakfast at a nearby place for about 7 euros( turn left walking out of the hotel) just 50 meters away . The metro system connects the hotel with the rest of central Barcelona within 15 minutes. The metro stations closest to the hotel are Diagonal and Passieg de Gracia. There is also a wide choice of buses. The hotel can order black-and-yellow taxis on request, but it is cheaper to stop one. I would come back anytime, can recommend it to everybody, but it would be nic e if the WIFI internet in the rooms was complimentary !

Reviews.Title: “4 nights in Barceloa”
Reviews.Author: PatnPeter
Reviews.Content: We were warmly and efficiently welcomed on arrival and as it was late, given directions to a selection of restaurants. We went to the Costa Gallega, just round the corner on beautiful Passieg de Gracia.Excellent Spanish food, crowds of Spanish people eating there. Our standard room was good. Big enough, good bed, plenty of clean thick towels and an excellent shower and bath. Breakfast was superb, wonderful selection - though a second cup of coffee or tea always had to be asked for. During our four days we planned our visits so that we could walk and soak up the ambiance of Barcelona. On the odd occasion when we needed to cover a longer distance than time would allow we took a taxi. The prices were not expensive compared with uk. The Alexandra is close to la Pedera and to Casa Batllo. It's worth knowing that the Picasso Museum is closed on Sun and Mon and is very busy on Tues mornings. If you want to visit the Palau de la Musicayou need to book in advance and the Guell Palace is closed at present. We recommend Barcelona and this conveniently situated hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beware roadside rooms”
Reviews.Author: ABCDEFC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for 2 nights in February. I was given a room looking onto the Main road - this is not condusive to an early night. Spanish drivers like to blast their horns all day and all night and these were very audible in my room even with the window closed. I had to leave it open as much as possible however to try to cool the room down. I found breakfast rather disappointing and used room service one night as I arrived late at the hotel. I would advise against doing so. Internet access is wireless but costs 12 euros a day and to top things off, I was denied the use of an iron on health and safety grounds. There are a lot of hotels in Barcelona and some must be better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: kukulu
Reviews.Content: it is a real small nice hotel with super comfortable rooms. Location is super. The only problem is that the prices went up so dramaticlly that it become too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Much Ado...”
Reviews.Author: Soundesigner
Reviews.Content: The Hotel has a great position especially for shopping, being just next to Passeig de Gracia. Be sure breakfast is included in your rate because I had to spend 34 extra EUR for 2 people. The personnel is quite gentle, the (standard) rooms have everything you need, but the problem if your room is on the street is the NOISE. The rooms are not sound isolated and so you can clearly hear all the drunk people on the street late at night and the traffic early in the morning. I was at the 2nd floor, I don't know if above was the same... Anyway I thing it doesn't worth what i've paid for (240 eur for one night)

HotelInfo.Name: Alexandra Barcelona Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Mallorca 251, 08008 Barcelona, Spain
